com.guardtime.ksi.util

Class Util

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.guardtime.ksi.util.Util

  • public final class Util
extends Object
    A collection of miscellaneous, commonly used utility functions.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int DEFAULT_BUFFER_SIZE
      The default buffer size for the data read/copy operations in this class.

    • Field Detail

      • DEFAULT_BUFFER_SIZE

        public static final int DEFAULT_BUFFER_SIZE
        The default buffer size for the data read/copy operations in this class.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • addCrc32

        public static byte[] addCrc32(byte[] b)
                       throws NullPointerException,
                              ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException
        Computes the CRC32 checksum for the given data.

        The checksum is appended to the original data and the result returned in a newly allocated array.

        Parameters:
        b - the data to compute the checksum for.
        Returns:
        an array containing the original data with the CRC appended to it.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if b is null.
        ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if the half-range [off..off+len) is not in [0..b.length).

      • addCrc32

        public static byte[] addCrc32(byte[] b,
                              int off,
                              int len)
                       throws NullPointerException,
                              ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException
        Computes the CRC32 checksum for len bytes of the given data, starting from off.

        The checksum is appended to the original data and the result returned in a newly allocated array.

        Parameters:
        b - the buffer containing the data to compute the checksum for.
        off - the buffer containing the data to compute the checksum for.
        len - number of bytes to include in the checksum.
        Returns:
        an array containing specified data bytes with CRC appended to it.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if b is null.
        ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if the half-range [off..off+len) is not in [0..b.length).

      • calculateCrc32

        public static byte[] calculateCrc32(byte[] b,
                                    int off,
                                    int length)
        Computes the CRC32 checksum for length bytes of the given data, starting from off.
        Parameters:
        b - the buffer containing the data to compute the checksum for.
        off - the buffer containing the data to compute the checksum for.
        length - number of bytes to include in the checksum.
        Returns:
        an array containing calculated CRC32 value.

      • decodeString

        public static String decodeString(byte[] buf,
                                  int ofs,
                                  int len)
                           throws CharacterCodingException
        Decodes UTF-8 string from the given buffer.
        Parameters:
        buf - the buffer.
        ofs - offset of the UTF-8 data in the buffer.
        len - length of the UTF-8 data to decode.
        Returns:
        the decoded string.
        Throws:
        CharacterCodingException - when the specified data is not in valid UTF-8 format.

      • toByteArray

        public static byte[] toByteArray(String value)
        Encodes the given string in UTF-8.
        Parameters:
        value - the string to encode.
        Returns:
        a newly allocated array containing the encoding result.

        Returns:

        Returns:

      • copyOf

        public static byte[] copyOf(byte[] b)
        Creates a copy of the given byte array.
        Parameters:
        b - the array to copy.
        Returns:
        copy of b, or null if b is null.

      • copyOf

        public static byte[] copyOf(byte[] b,
                            int off,
                            int len)
                     throws NullPointerException,
                            ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException
        Creates a copy of a section of the given byte array.
        Parameters:
        b - the array to copy.
        off - the start offset of the data within b.
        len - the number of bytes to copy.
        Returns:
        copy of the requested section of b.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if b is null.
        ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if the half-range [off..off+len) is not in [0..b.length).

      • join

        public static byte[] join(byte[] a,
                          byte[] b)
        Joins two byte arrays to one
        Parameters:
        a - first byte array to join. not null
        b - second byte array to join. not null.
        Returns:
        joined byte array.

      • lcm

        public static int lcm(int a,
                      int b)
               throws ArithmeticException
        Computes the least common multiple (LCM) of two integers.

        Least common multiple is the smallest positive integer that can be divided by both numbers without a remainder.

        Parameters:
        a - the first integer.
        b - the second integer.
        Returns:
        the least common multiple of a and b, or 0, if either a or b is 0.
        Throws:
        ArithmeticException - when the result is too big to fit into an int.

      • gcd

        public static int gcd(int a,
                      int b)
        Computes the greatest common divisor (GCD) of two integers.

        Greatest common divisor is the largest integer that divides both numbers without remainder.

        Parameters:
        a - the first integer.
        b - the second integer.
        Returns:
        the greatest common divisor of a and b, or 0, if both a and b are 0.

      • toByteArray

        public static byte[] toByteArray(short value)
        Converts value to two-byte array.

        Bytes are returned in network byte order (ordered from the most to the least significant byte).

        Parameters:
        value - the value to convert.
        Returns:
        the converted bytes as an array.

      • toByteArray

        public static byte[] toByteArray(int value)
        Converts value to four-byte array.

        Bytes are returned in network byte order (ordered from the most to the least significant byte).

        Parameters:
        value - the value to convert.
        Returns:
        the converted bytes as an array.

      • toByteArray

        public static byte[] toByteArray(long value)
        Converts value to eight-byte array.

        Bytes are returned in network byte order (ordered from the most to the least significant byte).

        Parameters:
        value - the value to convert.
        Returns:
        the converted bytes as an array.

      • toShort

        public static short toShort(byte[] b)
        Converts the first two bytes of b to a 16-bit signed integer.

        Assumes network byte order (ordered from the most to the least significant byte).

        Parameters:
        b - the buffer to read from.
        Returns:
        the converted value.

      • toShort

        public static short toShort(byte[] b,
                            int offset)
        Converts two bytes of b, starting from offset, to a 16-bit signed integer.

        Assumes network byte order (ordered from the most to the least significant byte).

        Parameters:
        b - the buffer to read from.
        offset - start offset in the buffer.
        Returns:
        the converted value.

      • toInt

        public static int toInt(byte[] b)
        Converts the first four bytes of b to a 32-bit signed integer.

        Assumes network byte order (ordered from the most to the least significant byte).

        Parameters:
        b - the buffer to read from.
        Returns:
        the converted value.

      • toInt

        public static int toInt(byte[] b,
                        int offset)
        Converts four bytes of b, starting from offset, to a 32-bit signed integer.

        Assumes network byte order (ordered from the most to the least significant byte).

        Parameters:
        b - the buffer to read from.
        offset - start offset in the buffer.
        Returns:
        the converted value.

      • toLong

        public static long toLong(byte[] b)
        Converts the first eight bytes of b to a 64-bit signed integer.

        Assumes network byte order (ordered from the most to the least significant byte).

        Parameters:
        b - the buffer to read from.
        Returns:
        the converted value.

      • toLong

        public static long toLong(byte[] b,
                          int offset)
        Converts eight bytes of b, starting from offset, to a 64-bit signed integer.

        Assumes network byte order (ordered from the most to the least significant byte).

        Parameters:
        b - the buffer to read from.
        offset - start offset in the buffer.
        Returns:
        the converted value.

      • decodeUnsignedLong

        public static long decodeUnsignedLong(byte[] buf,
                                      int ofs,
                                      int len)
                               throws IllegalArgumentException
        Decodes an unsigned integer from the given buffer.
        Parameters:
        buf - the buffer.
        ofs - offset of the data in the buffer.
        len - length of the data to decode.
        Returns:
        the decoded value.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - when result does not fit into 63-bit unsigned integer.

      • encodeUnsignedLong

        public static byte[] encodeUnsignedLong(long value)
        Encodes the given value in a minimal number of bytes, in network byte order (most significant bits first).
        Parameters:
        value - the value to encode (the encoding is unsigned, so only non-negative values are supported).
        Returns:
        a newly allocated array containing the encoding result.

      • calculateHMAC

        public static byte[] calculateHMAC(byte[] message,
                                   byte[] keyBytes,
                                   String algorithm)
                            throws NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                                   InvalidKeyException
        Calculates the RFC 2104 compatible HMAC for the given message, key and algorithm.
        Parameters:
        message - message for which the MAC is to be calculated
        keyBytes - key for calculation
        algorithm - algorithm to be used (MD5, SHA1, SHA256)
        Returns:
        hmac as byte array
        Throws:
        NoSuchAlgorithmException - if invalid algorithm is provided
        InvalidKeyException - if invalid key is provided
        IllegalArgumentException - if hmac key is nll

      • copyData

        public static int copyData(InputStream in,
                           OutputStream out)
                    throws IOException
        Copies all available data from in to out.

        Allocates a temporary memory buffer of DEFAULT_BUFFER_SIZE bytes for this.

        Parameters:
        in - input stream to copy data from.
        out - output stream to copy data to.
        Returns:
        the number of bytes actually copied.
        Throws:
        IOException - if one is thrown by either in or out.

      • copyData

        public static int copyData(InputStream in,
                           OutputStream out,
                           int limit,
                           int bufSize)
                    throws IOException
        Copies up to limit bytes of data from in to out.

        May copy less than limit bytes if in does not have that much data available.

        Allocates a temporary memory buffer of bufSize bytes for this.

        Parameters:
        in - input stream to copy data from.
        out - output stream to copy data to.
        limit - maximum number of bytes to copy (-1 to copy all bytes).
        bufSize - size of the buffer to allocate (larger buffer may speed up the process).
        Returns:
        the number of bytes actually copied.
        Throws:
        IOException - if one is thrown by either in or out.

      • copyData

        public static int copyData(InputStream in,
                           OutputStream out,
                           int limit)
                    throws IOException
        Copies up to limit bytes of data from in to out.

        May copy less than limit bytes if in does not have that much data available.

        Allocates a temporary memory buffer of DEFAULT_BUFFER_SIZE bytes for this.

        Parameters:
        in - input stream to copy data from.
        out - output stream to copy data to.
        limit - maximum number of bytes to copy.
        Returns:
        the number of bytes actually copied.
        Throws:
        IOException - if one is thrown by either in or out.

      • closeQuietly

        public static void closeQuietly(InputStream input)
        Closes an InputStream unconditionally.

        Equivalent to InputStream.close(), except any exceptions will be ignored. This is typically used in finally blocks.

        Parameters:
        input - InputStream to close

      • closeQuietly

        public static void closeQuietly(OutputStream output)
        Closes an OutputStream unconditionally.

        Equivalent to OutputStream.close(), except any exceptions will be ignored. This is typically used in finally blocks.

        Parameters:
        output - OutputStream to close

      • nextLong

        public static Long nextLong()

        Returns the next pseudorandom, uniformly distributed long value from the Math.random() sequence.

        N!B! All values are greater than or equal to zero.
        Returns:
        the random long
